Transcription for 19088

Oh, I had to go on the parish and there was soup kitchens started.
People going out to soup.
Oh yes, yes certain people.
And I remember boys running about in no shoes and stuck in, about here.
They were so poor to buy shoes.
And there was cobbleroads then, it wasn't a road like today.
They cracked the stones for men that were on the parish in the workhouse.
Everybody had to come out on the roads and crack stones to make the roads.
